div1.p: Hanson sends Carter a copy of a letter reporting on the yellow fever work in South America.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Hanson to Henry Rose Carter, September 3, 1921

My Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am sending you the enclosed copy
because I think it contains several points in which you are
interested. I put a foot note on telling Rose that I am sending
you this copy. I have several letters from you which I will
answer as soon as possible.

I have just returned from a trip to Panama as you notice
and believe me I hated the idea of another such a long separation
from the Wife and those cute little kiddies. Martha says that
when Daddy doesnt come back she is going to take a big boat and go
to Dr. Carter.

I will write you before starting south. I trust you will
write me as often as your time permits. I very much enjoyed having
White here, but was sorry that you did not come with him.
